intro: Aeschynomene sensitiva f. paucifoliolata, commonly known as the sensitive aeschynomene, is a variant of the species Aeschynomene sensitiva, characterized by its reduced foliage. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and parts of Asia. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family. It typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often with a distinctive yellow or white coloration.
